alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 6:22PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Fayette and southeastern Shelby Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 622 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Frayser, or 7 miles west of Bartlett, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bartlett, Collierville, Germantown, Cordova, Memphis, Lakeland, Arlington, Ellendale, Southeast Memphis, Downtown Memphis, Eads, Frayser, Midtown Memphis, Piperton, Lenow, Woodstock, Kirk, Elmore Park, Fisherville and Raleigh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...northwestern Mississippi...and west Tennessee.
